info: Hufflepuff student in Harry Potter's year. Prefect and member of Dumbledore's Army. Married to Neville Longbottom.
Head of the Department of Magical Games and Sports within the Ministry of Magic.
Author of A History of Magic, and the great aunt of Gellert Grindelwald.
Gryffindor Quidditch Chaser one year above Harry Potter. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
ghost, History of Magic professor.
Great-great-grandfather of Sirius Black and former Hogwarts headmaster. His painting hangs in the office and assists the current headmaster.

Harry's godfather who was a close friend of Harry's father James. Escapee from Azkaban prison and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed in the Battle of the Department of Mysteries by his cousin Bellatrix Lestrange.
Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement, and the aunt of Susan Bones. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Hufflepuff student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year and member of Dumbledore's Army. Killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Member of Dolores Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad.
Professor of Muggle Studies at Hogwarts. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Muggle gardener for the Riddle family. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Death Eater and sister of Amycus Carrow. Professor of Muggle Studies for one year, and Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts under Severus Snape.
Death Eater and brother of Alecto Carrow. Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts for one year, and Deputy Headmaster of Hogwarts under Snape.
Employee of the Magical Maintenance Department for the Ministry of Magic. Impersonated by Ron Weasley.
Ravenclaw Quidditch Seeker one year above Harry, and his first love interest. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Ravenclaw prefect and girlfriend of Percy Weasley.
Death Eater and father of Vincent Crabbe.
Slytherin student in Harry's year and the son of a Death Eater. Slytherin Quidditch Beater and member of the Inquisitorial Squad. Killed by his own Fiendfyre spell.
Muggle-born Gryffindor student one year below Harry. Older brother of Dennis Creevey, and member of Dumbledore's Army. Killed during the Battle of Hogwarts.
Muggle-born Gryffindor student three years below Harry. Younger brother of Colin Creevey, and member of Dumbledore's Army.
Muggle-born Head of the Goblin Liaison Office, went on the run with fellow Muggle-borns Ted Tonks, Dean Thomas and goblins Gornuk and Griphook, during which he is killed.
Head of the Department of International Magical Cooperation. Killed by his son Barty Crouch Jr.
Death Eater credited with facilitating the return of Lord Voldemort. Used Polyjuice Potion to impersonate Alastor Moody, and received a Dementor's Kiss.
an Auror.
Participant in the Triwizard Tournament as a representative of wizarding school Beauxbatons. Later married Bill Weasley.
Fleur's younger sister. Rescued by Harry during the Triwizard Tournament.
Member of the Order of the Phoenix who took the Dursleys into hiding.
Cedric Diggory's father. Employee of the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures.
Hufflepuff student and prefect two years above Harry. Quidditch Seeker and captain, and co-winner of the Triwizard Tournament. Killed by Peter Pettigrew on Lord Voldemort's command.
A school friend of Albus Dumbledore.
Death Eater who killed Fabian Prewett, Gideon Prewett, and Remus Lupin.
Brother of Albus and Ariana Dumbledore. Owner of the Hog's Head tavern.
Transfiguration professor in Tom Riddle's time, and Hogwarts headmaster in Harry Potter's time. Founder of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed by Severus Snape on Dumbledore's request.
Sister of Albus and Aberforth Dumbledore, killed in a three-way duel between her brothers and Gellert Grindelwald.
Wife of Percival Dumbledore. Mother of Albus, Aberforth, and Ariana Dumbledore.
Husband of Kendra Dumbledore, father of Albus, Aberforth, and Ariana Dumbledore.
Muggle son of Vernon Dursley and Petunia Evans, first cousin of Harry Potter.
Muggle sister of Vernon Dursley.
Harry's aunt, and his mother Lily's sister.  Vernon's wife and Dudley's mother.
Harry Potter's Muggle uncle. Petunia's husband and Dudley's father.
Ravenclaw student one year above Harry. Member of Dumbledore's Army who later betrays the group to Dolores Umbridge.
Squib neighbour of the Dursleys. Member of the Order of the Phoenix.
Squib caretaker of Hogwarts.
Muggle-born Hufflepuff student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Creator and owner of the Philosopher's Stone.
Common thief and shifty Order of the Phoenix member.
Head of Ravenclaw House and Charms professor at Hogwarts.
Minister for Magic in the first five books. Sacked after persistently denying Lord Voldemort's return.
The pure-blood father of Merope and Morfin Gaunt, and grandfather of Tom Marvolo Riddle.
Tom Riddle's mother who died in childbirth.
Marvolo's son and Merope's brother. Framed by his nephew Tom Riddle for Muggle killings, and died in Azkaban.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Death Eater and father of Gregory Goyle.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Slytherin Quidditch Beater and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.
Muggle-born Gryffindor student in Harry's year and one of his best friends. Prefect and co-founder of Dumbledore's Army.
Draco Malfoy's wife. She died in 2019 due to her blood curse.
highly regarded Eastern European wandmaker.
Werewolf working for the Death Eaters.
Dark wizard who was jailed after Albus Dumbledore defeated him in the 1940s.
Substitute Care of Magical Creatures professor during Harry's fourth and fifth years.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts. He was a very powerful wizard.
Half-giant Hogwarts gamekeeper, and Care of Magical Creatures professor starting in Harry's third year. Member of the Order of the Phoenix. As a Hogwarts student, he was expelled in his third year.
Hogwarts flying instructor and Quidditch referee.
Witch who works in the Ministry of Magic. Impersonated by Hermione Granger.
Founder of Hufflepuff House. Co-founder of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Gryffindor student two years above Harry. Quidditch Chaser and later team captain.
Gryffindor student two years above Harry. Hogwarts Quidditch commentator and good friend of Fred and George Weasley.
Ministry of Magic employee that worked under the Department of Magical Games and Sports. Killed by Voldemort in order to create Nagini as the last horcrux.
Reformed Death Eater. Headmaster of wizarding school Durmstrang.
Bulgarian Quidditch Seeker and Durmstrang student who participated in the Triwizard Tournament.
Care of Magical Creatures teacher until Harry's third year.
Cousin of Sirius Black. Death Eater who tortured Neville Longbottom's parents Frank and Alice into insanity. Killed by Molly Weasley during the Battle of Hogwarts.
Fraudulent celebrity author and Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. Lost his memory after a memory charm backfired and resided in St. Mungo's afterwards.
Neville Longbottom's parents. Aurors and members of the original Order of the Phoenix. Tortured into insanity by Bellatrix Lestrange.
Frank's mother and Neville's grandmother, who raises him after his parents are incapacitated.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Xenophilius Lovegood's daughter and Ravenclaw student one year below Harry. Member of Dumbledore's Army and wife of Newt Scamander's grandson Rolf.
Luna's father. Editor of tabloid magazine The Quibbler.

Lycanthropic Gryffindor student before Harry's time who befriended Sirius Black and James Potter. Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts in Harry's third year, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. He and his wife Nymphadora Tonks gave birth to a son, Teddy, before dying in the Battle of Hogwarts.
Death Eater and Committee of Disposal of Dangerous Creatures' executioner. Injured badly by Hagrid during the Battle of Hogwarts.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Quidditch Seeker, prefect, and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.
Draco's father and an influential Death Eater. Governor of Hogwarts early in the series.
Lucius' wife and Draco's mother. Sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Andromeda Tonks.
Son of Draco Malfoy and Astoria Greengrass. Sorted into Slytherin. Friends with Albus Potter.
Clothing shop owner in Diagon Alley.
Governor of the Wizarding Examinations Authority which ran the O.W.L, N.E.W.T., and W.O.M.B.A.T. exams. Wizengamot elder.
Half-giantess. Headmistress of Beauxbatons.
Hufflepuff student in Harry's year. Prefect and member of Dumbledore's Army.

Hogwarts Transfiguration professor, Head of Gryffindor House, Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Assumes position of Hogwarts Headmaster for a time after Voldemort's death.
Gryffindor student that accidentally removed her nose trying to get rid of her acne. Known for her bad case of acne.
Gryffindor student one year above Harry Potter. Quidditch Keeper and member of Horace Slughorn's Slug Club.
Slytherin Quidditch Chaser who became trapped inside a Vanishing Cabinet for a day.
Retired Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Impersonated by Barty Crouch Jr. in his scheme to enter Harry into the Triwizard Tournament. Killed by Voldemort.
Slytherin student in the same year as Harry Potter, and son of a Death Eater.
Theodore Nott's father. Death Eater.
Leader of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement Squad in the 1920s. Turned the Gaunt family over to the Wizengamot for using magic in front of a Muggle. Died before Harry Potter's sixth year.
Wandmaker and owner of the Ollivanders wand shop. Kidnapped by the Malfoy family for several months until freed by Harry, Ron, and Hermione.
Slytherin student in Harry's year. Prefect and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year. Identical twin sister of Gryffindor student Parvati Patil, and a member of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year and Padma's identical twin sister. Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Death Eater and former school friend of James Potter, Sirius Black and Remus Lupin. Betrays Harry's parents James and Lily Potter to Voldemort, resulting in their deaths. Pettigrew is first introduced in the series as Ron Weasley's pet rat Scabbers. He is strangled to death by his own metal prosthetic hand after his loyalty towards Voldemort wavers upon Harry confronting him about having previously spared Pettigrew's life.
Three brothers who were the original owners of the Elder Wand, the Resurrection Stone, and the Invisibility Cloak, respectively.
Hogwarts librarian.
Member of the Order of the Phoenix.
Hogwarts school nurse.

The main character of the series. Orphaned son of James and Lily Potter. Gryffindor student at Hogwarts, and co-founder and first leader of Dumbledore's Army. The husband of Ginny Weasley, father of James Sirius, Albus Severus and Lily Luna Potter.
Harry Potter's father and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed along with his wife Lily by Lord Voldemort prior to the start of the series.
Harry Potter's mother and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed by Lord Voldemort.
Second child of Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley.
Harry and Ginny's first child.
Harry and Ginny's third child.
Defence Against the Dark Arts professor in Harry Potter's first year. Possessed by Lord Voldemort.
Daughter of house founder Rowena Ravenclaw. Stole and hid her mother's diadem, and became Ravenclaw's house ghost after being killed by the Bloody Baron.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and founder of the Ravenclaw house.

The main antagonist of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child and daughter of Voldemort and Bellatrix Lestrange who tries to bring Voldemort back to life by completing a prophecy. Currently imprisoned in Azkaban.
Thomas Riddle Sr.'s Muggle wife, and Thomas Riddle Jr.'s mother. Killed by her grandson, Lord Voldemort.
Mary's Muggle husband and Thomas Riddle Jr.'s father. Killed by Voldemort.
Voldemort's Muggle father and Merope Gaunt's husband. Killed by his son, Lord Voldemort.
Slytherin student who became Lord Voldemort.
Gryffindor student and Quidditch Chaser.
Death Eater and spy working in the Department of Mysteries.
Death Eater.
Ministry of Magic employee whose chief function was as an investigator of alleged Muggle-borns.
Magizoologist and author of Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. Main character in the Fantastic Beasts film series. Expelled Hogwarts student who excels in curing different sicknesses.
Head of the Auror Office who replaces Cornelius Fudge as Minister for Magic. Killed by Death Eaters.
Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Replaces Pius Thicknesse as Minister for Magic.
Conductor of the triple-decker Knight Bus. Jailed in Azkaban on suspicions of being a Death Eater.
Astronomy professor at Hogwarts.
Reporter and tabloid journalist for the Daily Prophet.
Former Hogwarts Potions professor and Head of Slytherin House, whose charges included Tom Riddle. Returned to Hogwarts to teach Potions in Harry's sixth year.
One of the four founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and founder of the Slytherin house.
Hufflepuff Quidditch Chaser in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Potions and later Defence Against the Dark Arts professor at Hogwarts. Head of Slytherin House, and member of both the Death Eaters and the Order of the Phoenix as a double agent spying for Dumbledore.
Gryffindor student two years above Harry. Quidditch Chaser and member of Dumbledore's Army.
Hogwarts Herbology professor and Head of Hufflepuff House.
Minister for Magic while under the Imperius Curse. Replaced by Kingsley Shacklebolt.
Gryffindor student in Harry's year. Member of Dumbledore's Army.
Sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Narcissa Malfoy, and the mother of Nymphadora Tonks. Disowned by her family for marrying Muggle-born Ted Tonks.
Ted and Andromeda's daughter. Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. She marries Remus Lupin and becomes the mother of a son, Teddy, before she and Remus are killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.
Andromeda's Muggle-born husband, and the father of Nymphadora Tonks. Killed by Snatchers.
Hogwarts Divination professor. Predicted the prophecy that prompted Lord Voldemort to go after the Potters.
Hogwarts Apparition instructor who works in the Department of Magical Transportation.

Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic, Hogwarts High Inquisitor and temporary Headmistress of Hogwarts. She becomes Defence Against the Dark Arts professor in Harry Potter's fifth year, and joins in the persecution of half-bloods and Muggle-borns under Voldemort. Sentenced to life imprisonment in Azkaban.
Member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed by Death Eaters.
Gryffindor student who unsuccessfully tries to romance Harry.
Arithmancy professor at Hogwarts.
The villain of the series. Murderer of Harry Potter's parents and many others in his quest for immortality and absolute power.
Muggle-born Ravenclaw student during Tom Riddle's time at Hogwarts. Killed by the Basilisk in a girls' bathroom, which she continued to haunt after her death.
Muggle-obsessed Ministry of Magic employee, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Husband of Molly Weasley, father of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny Weasley.
Oldest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley, and Gringotts employee. Marries Fleur Delacour.
Second son of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Member of the Order of the Phoenix. Works with dragons in Romania.

Son of Arthur and Molly Weasley and identical twin brother of George Weasley. Gryffindor Quidditch Beater and member of Dumbledore's Army, later co-owner of joke shop Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Son of Arthur and Molly Weasley and identical twin brother of Fred Weasley. Gryffindor Quidditch Beater and member of Dumbledore's Army. Co-owner of Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Marries Angelina Johnson.
Only daughter and youngest child of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Gryffindor student one year below Harry, Quidditch Seeker and Chaser, and member of Dumbledore's Army. Married to Harry Potter.
Son of Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, brother of Rose Weasley.
Wife of Arthur Weasley and mother of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny. Member of the Order of the Phoenix.

Third son of Arthur and Molly Weasley. Gryffindor prefect and Head Boy, then Ministry of Magic employee, during which he becomes estranged from his family before joining them in fighting the Death Eaters in the Battle of Hogwarts.
Youngest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley who is best friends with Harry Potter and Hermione Granger. Gryffindor Quidditch Keeper, prefect, and co-founder of Dumbledore's Army.
Gryffindor Quidditch Keeper and captain four years above Harry.
Daughter of Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger. Sister of Hugo Weasley.
Death Eater. Head of Magical Law Enforcement under Voldemort's regime.
Slytherin student in Harry's year.
Giant spider raised by Rubeus Hagrid and lived in the Forbidden Forest.
Centaur, not very wizard-friendly.
Author of several wizarding fairy tales including The Tale of the Three Brothers.
Slytherin House ghost. Suitor of Helena Ravenclaw before killing her in a fit of blind rage, then commits suicide in remorse.
Head goblin at Gringotts Wizarding Bank. Put under the Imperius curse when Harry, Ron, and Hermione break into Gringotts.
Hippogriff belonging at various times to Hagrid, Sirius Black and Harry Potter.
Armored and somewhat mad knight occupying a painting in Hogwarts.
Intelligent cat belonging to Hermione Granger.
House-elf originally belonging to the Malfoy family until he is set free by Harry in Chamber of Secrets, killed by Bellatrix Lestrange in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.
Owl belonging to the Weasley family.
Hagrid's pet boarhound.
Hufflepuff House ghost.
Witch in the painting concealing the entrance to the Gryffindor common room.
Phoenix belonging to Albus Dumbledore. Saved Harry Potter from the Basilisk inside the Chamber of Secrets.
Centaur and substitute Divination professor at Hogwarts during Harry's fifth year.
Three-headed dog belonging to Hagrid and protector of the Philosopher's Stone.
Gringotts goblin who goes on the run from Death Eaters in Deathly Hallows along with fellow goblin Griphook, plus Dean Thomas, Ted Tonks, and Dirk Cresswell.
Giant and Hagrid's half-brother.
Gringotts Bank goblin who helps Harry and his friends steal Helga Hufflepuff's cup from within the Lestrange vault.
Harry Potter's pet owl. Killed during the Battle of the Seven Potters.
House-elf belonging to Hepzibah Smith.

House-elf belonging to the Black family and later Harry Potter. Though at first preferring to serve the pureblood line (including Regulus Black, Narcissa Malfoy, Bellatrix Lestrange, and Draco Malfoy), he eventually prefers serving under Harry as he treats him better.
A centaur.
The Weasley children's great-aunt.
Lord Voldemort's massive pet snake that does his bidding. She is one of Voldemort's Horcruxes who is ultimately slain by Neville Longbottom during the Battle of Hogwarts.
Gryffindor house ghost. Full name is Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington.
A baby dragon illegally owned by Hagrid who is relocated to a reserve in Romania by friends of Ron's older brother Charlie Weasley.
Hogwarts poltergeist, a mischievous magical being.
A tiny mischievous owl belonging to Ron Weasley. Called "Pig" for short.
Proprietor of The Three Broomsticks inn in Hogsmeade village.
A centaur living in the Forbidden Forest.
Ron Weasley's pet rat in the first three stories who is revealed to be a wizard in animal form: Peter Pettigrew.
Snatcher who captures Harry, Ron and Hermione in Deathly Hallows.
Wizard and Death Eater who escapes from Azkaban after Lord Voldemort's return.
Neville Longbottom's perpetually-misplaced pet toad.
A female house-elf who belonged to Barty Crouch Sr until he sacked her, then worked in the Hogwarts kitchen.
